fi.grimripper.loww.tiles

Class Square

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.Tile
      • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.Square

  • public class Square
extends Tile
    Represents a single square in a tile grid. Each square has up to eight neighbors, including diagonal ones. Minimum number of neighbors for a square in a rectangular grid is three: horizontal, vertical and diagonal. This is a square in a corner of the tile grid. The width and height of a square are equal, and each square has the same dimensions as every other square, but their locations vary.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen

    • Field Detail

      • SQUARE_SIZE

        public static final int SQUARE_SIZE
        Declares the number of points and sides to a square: four.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_NEIGHBORS

        public static final int MAX_NEIGHBORS
        Declares the maximum number of adjacent neighbors a square can have: eight. This includes two horizontal and two vertical neighbors which share a side with the square, and four diagonal neighbors which share a point.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSquarePoints

        public static Direction[] getSquarePoints()
        Gets an array with the four directions of a square's points. They're in clockwise order, starting from northeast.
        Returns:
        directions of a square's points

      • getNeighborDirections

        public static Direction[] getNeighborDirections()
        Gets the directions where a square can have neighbors. Diagonal neighbors are allowed, so all eight major and minor compass directions are possible.
        Returns:
        possible directions for a square's neighbors

        public Point getPoint(Direction corner)
        Gets one of the square's corner points. Squares have points in the four diagonal compass directions.

      • containsCoords

        public Square containsCoords(double x,
                    double y)
        Description copied from class: Tile
        Gets an approximation of which tile contains the given coordinates. If they're within this tile, returns the tile itself. Otherwise returns one of its neighbors, the one closest to the given coordinates.
        Specified by:
        containsCoords in class Tile
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate
        Returns:
        this tile if the coordinates are inside it, or the closest neighbor (can be null if there isn't a neighbor in the correct direction)
